outline:
1. to be strange, be a stranger
    1. (Qal)
      1. to become estranged
      2. strange, another, stranger, foreigner, an enemy (participle)
      3. loathsome (of breath) (participle)
      4. strange woman, prostitute, harlot (meton)
    2. (Niphal) to be estranged
    3. (Hophal) to be a stranger, be one alienated
kjv_def: (come from) another (man, place), fanner, go away, (e-) strange(-r, thing, woman).
strongs_def: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
